Package oracle.kubernetes.operator

Class JobWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.kubernetes.operator.JobWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WatchListener<io.kubernetes.client.models.V1Job>
    public class JobWatcher
extends Object
implements WatchListener<io.kubernetes.client.models.V1Job>
    Watches for Jobs to become Ready or leave Ready state.

      • getOrCreateFor

        @Nonnull
public static JobWatcher getOrCreateFor​(Domain domain)
        Returns a cached JobWatcher, if present; otherwise, creates a new one.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain for which the job watcher is to be returned
        Returns:
        a cached jobwatcher.

      • create

        public static JobWatcher create​(ThreadFactory factory,
                                String ns,
                                String initialResourceVersion,
                                TuningParameters.WatchTuning tuning,
                                AtomicBoolean isStopping)
        Creates a new JobWatcher and caches it by namespace.
        Parameters:
        factory - thread factory
        ns - Namespace
        initialResourceVersion - Initial resource version or empty string
        tuning - Tuning parameters for the watch, for example watch lifetime
        isStopping - Stop signal
        Returns:
        Job watcher for the namespace

        public WatchI<io.kubernetes.client.models.V1Job> initiateWatch​(WatchBuilder watchBuilder)
                                                        throws io.kubernetes.client.ApiException
        Initiates a watch by using the watch builder to request any updates for the specified watcher.
        Parameters:
        watchBuilder - the watch builder, initialized with the current resource version.
        Returns:
        Watch object or null if the operation should end
        Throws:
        io.kubernetes.client.ApiException - if there is an API error.
